    Sparse Multidimensional Scaling

    sparseMDS.Rd

    Performs sparse multidimensional scaling (MDS) on a given data matrix.

    Usage

    sparseMDS(
  DATA,
  masses = NULL,
  components = 0,
  tol = .Machine$double.eps,
  method = "distance",
  init = "svd",
  seed = NULL,
  grp = NULL,
  rds = rep(1, components),
  orthogonality = "loadings",
  OrthSpace = NULL,
  projPriority = "orth",
  itermaxALS = 1000,
  itermaxPOCS = 1000,
  epsALS = 1e-10,
  epsPOCS = 1e-10
)

    Arguments

    DATA

    The data matrix for MDS analysis.

    masses

    A vector of masses for the rows/columns; defaults to NULL with equal masses of 1/(number of rows).

    components

    The number of dimensions for the analysis; defaults to 0.

    tol

    Tolerance for the convergence criterion; defaults to .Machine$double.eps.

    method

    Method for analysis, either "distance" or "covariance".

    init

    Initialization method; defaults to "svd".

    seed

    Seed for random number generation; defaults to NULL.

    rds

    Radii for the analysis; defaults to rep(1, components).

    orthogonality

    Type of orthogonality constraint; defaults to "loadings".

    OrthSpace

    Orthogonal space for the analysis; defaults to NULL.

    projPriority

    Priority of the projection; defaults to "orth".

    itermaxALS

    Maximum number of ALS iterations; defaults to 1000.

    itermaxPOCS

    Maximum number of POCS iterations; defaults to 1000.

    epsALS

    Convergence criterion for ALS; defaults to 1e-10.

    epsPOCS

    Convergence criterion for POCS; defaults to 1e-10.

    Value

    Returns an object containing the results of the sparse MDS analysis, including eigenvalues, eigenvectors, and various metrics relevant to the analysis.

    Examples

    # Example usage of sparseMDS function
# Assuming `data` is a data matrix
#' \dontrun{result <- sparseMDS(DATA = data)}
